title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: SAIL draws plans for green push alongside diversification plans
items.author: Suryash Kumar, Twesh Mishra, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Green steel* push includes hydrogen-based steelmaking trials, CCUS, biochar, and renewable energy to decarbonize and modernize SAIL.
- *Diversification* targets sunrise sectors like renewable infrastructure, defence, and electric mobility, backed by automation and AI.
- Capacity will rise from ~19 to ~35 million tonnes by 2030–31, with expanded renewables such as floating/rooftop solar and bagasse power.

items.title: US factory output rises in August amid rebound
items.summary:
- *US factory output rose 0.2% in August*, led by a rebound in *motor vehicle and parts* and stronger *nondurable goods*. 
- *Year-over-year production rose 0.9% in August*, underscoring ongoing growth in the sector. 
- Tariffs weigh on some segments, but *AI spending* boosts others, shaping the mixed outlook for US manufacturing.

items.title: Interarch expands Andhra Pradesh plant phase
items.summary:
- Interarch Building Solutions announced a ₹53 crore expansion across its network, including Phase 2 of the Andhra Pradesh facility for PEBs. 
- The Nellore district plant adds 25,000 MT/year capacity with ₹32 crore investment near ports and industrial corridors, creating 200+ jobs. 
- The Uttarakhand Kichha plant upgrade adds a ₹21 crore Box Column Line and 15,000 MT/year capacity, boosting lead times and product versatility.

items.title: India to build full chip stack: 25 chipsets
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India plans to become a *product nation* by developing 25 strategic chipsets with homegrown IP for domestic and global markets, says Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- It aims to build the full semiconductor stack—design, manufacturing, equipment, materials and talent—with facilities like Arm’s Bengaluru R&D hub, including **2nm** chip design.
- The ISM 2.0 program will emphasize equipment and materials, fabs and ATMP, plus securing rare earths and critical minerals under the $1B India Deep Tech Alliance.

items.title: Videotex-Samsung to make Tizen TVs in India
items.summary:
- Videotex International Pvt, a home-grown ODM, partners with Samsung to locally manufacture Smart TVs powered by **Tizen OS** in India.
- The collaboration aims to deliver smarter, more intuitive viewing experiences to Indian consumers while reinforcing the **Make in India** ecosystem.
- Videotex, the largest ODM for *webOS Hub* TVs in India, says the move expands its capabilities and portfolio, servicing over 25 brands.

items.title: Gujarat adds record 6,632MW of green power in five months
items.summary:
- *Gujarat* added 6,632 MW of green power from April–August 2025, pushing its RE capacity to about 39,276 MW and nearly matching the entire previous fiscal year. 
- Growth comes from large-scale solar parks, wind farms, rooftop solar, and faster transmission, driven by supportive policy and lower costs. 
- By Aug 31, 2025, ~83% of FY2025 capacity additions occurred in five months, boosting *ESG* goals and setting a new state benchmark for green power.

items.title: FMCG price cuts to boost consumer savings
items.author: Asmita Dey
items.summary: - *HUL* is cutting prices by ₹5-₹76 across products and pack sizes, e.g., 400g *Horlicks* Women's Plus from ₹320 to ₹284.\n- *P&G* will cut ₹3-₹100 on Pamper, Pantene and Vicks from Sept 22, with shifts to larger packs.\n- *Parle* and *Amul* say savings will reach consumers through price cuts and bigger packs as MRPs on old packs are revised.

items.title: IIT Bhilai's self-healing polymer boosts EV safety
items.summary:
- *IIT Bhilai researchers* developed a **self-healing polymer** that repairs at room temperature, boosting safety and longevity for EVs, aircraft, and protective gear.
- The material absorbs strong impacts, heals without external heat, and can be pressed back together after cuts, signaling a *paradigm shift* in resilience.
- Made via a low-cost, scalable process and published in *Advanced Functional Materials*, the polymer is thermally stable, highly adhesive, reusable, and could cut replacements and carbon waste, with a patent filed.

items.title: Tata Sons head highlights capacity building opportunities in defence
ARM's new Bengaluru facility will design two-nanometer chips: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Govt plans to make stricter rules for operating UAV in India
items.summary:
- The government released the draft *Civil Drone (Promotion & Regulation) Bill, 2025*, proposing tougher rules for operating *UAVs* in India.
- It imposes penalties up to ₹1 lakh and up to six months’ imprisonment for violations and requires every unmanned aircraft system to be registered and issued a *UIN*.
- The bill also restricts sale/transfer of UAS unless registered, with transfer and de-registration procedures defined under central government oversight.

items.title: Jindal group company places bid for Thyssenkrupp steel division
items.summary:
- *Jindal Steel International*, the Naveen Jindal Group's global steel arm, made a *non-binding offer* to acquire Thyssenkrupp Steel Europe (*TKSE*).
- *Thyssenkrupp AG* will review the proposal; *no financial details* were disclosed.
- The plan includes a *hydrogen-ready DRI plant in Oman by 2027* and investing *over €2 billion* in new *electric-arc furnaces* in Germany to safeguard production and *decarbonisation*.

items.title: US rejects India's request for WTO consultation on 50% copper tariffs
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The US rejected India's WTO request for consultations over 50% copper tariffs, saying they are not *safeguard measures*.
- It told the *WTO* there is no basis for India to seek consultations under the AoS, as tariffs are not **safeguards** under **Section 232**.
- This is the **third rejection** by Washington after cases on steel/aluminium and autos.

items.title: Tata Consumer Products planning premiumisation of portfolio to drive growth in tea business
Divergent raises $290M to scale 3D printing
items.summary:
- Divergent Technologies raised $290 million at a $2.3 billion valuation to scale additive manufacturing for defense and aerospace.
- The round includes $250 million in equity and $40 million in debt, led by Rochefort Asset Management, to accelerate production facilities.
- The deal underscores strong investor interest in next-gen manufacturing tech amid supply-chain pressures in defense sectors.

items.title: India's chemicals sector leads globally with 28% TSR
items.summary:
- *India's chemicals sector* has become a global leader in value creation, delivering a five-year TSR of **28%** from 2020 to 2024, well above the global average of **7%**.
- This outperformance was driven by *domestic demand*, policy support, and rising investor sentiment that lifted valuation multiples, with agrochemicals, *pharmaceutical ingredients*, personal care, and engineered materials leading the gains.
- *BCG* notes that Indian firms focusing on *commercial excellence*, disciplined *capital allocation*, and *portfolio quality* are positioned to sustain momentum, including strong fertiliser demand.

items.title: GST 2.0's calm breeze drives growth
items.author: Arvind Singhania
items.summary: - **GST 2.0** simplifies to two main slabs (5% and 18%), reducing tax on everyday items and boosting *disposable income*.\n- Lower prices on essentials and aspirational goods will lift consumption across FMCG, housing, cars, and healthcare, fueling manufacturing growth.\n- Yet challenges remain, including state consensus, **inverted duty structure**, and revenue neutrality considerations.

items.title: MediaTek to use TSMC’s 2nm process for next flagship chip
Tyre industry revenue to ₹13L crore by 2047 (ATMA–PwC)
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - The Indian tyre industry could see revenues rise 12x to ₹13 lakh crore by 2047, with production up ~4x.\n- Growth drivers include *premiumisation*, exports, electrification, services, and the PwC-ATMA CHARGE framework.\n- Risks include rubber supply constraints, regulatory dynamics, and non-tariff barriers.

items.title: JSW MG Motor India urges stronger academia-industry links
items.summary:
- *JSW MG Motor India* is pushing for stronger *academia–industry collaboration*, partnering with around 25 universities to bridge the skill gap and benefit about 600–800 students with industry-focused learning. 
- It supports the gap by offering *technical lectures*, sharing course materials, and donating retired vehicle models, plus its ongoing *Developer Program* that connects startups to live projects. 
- Experts say curricula must evolve with *AI* and *cybersecurity*, with bodies like *ASDC* driving practical exposure to create industry-ready engineers and sustain innovation.

items.title: JLR extends production halt to Sept 24 after cyberattack
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Jaguar Land Rover has extended its production pause to Sept 24, 2025 as **forensic investigations** continue and a *phased restart* is considered. 
- The disruption is spilling into aftersales, with UK garages warning of parts delays and potential *new car deliveries* disruption. 
- The incident underscores JLR’s cybersecurity efforts, including a contract with **Tata Consultancy Services** and broader auto-industry risk.

items.title: MIC Electronics bags Indian Railways safety & info contracts
items.summary:
- MIC Electronics won contracts worth ₹1.76 crore from **Indian Railways** to deploy *passenger information systems* and *safety systems* across key divisions.
- In the Sambalpur Division of East Coast Railway, the company will upgrade eight stations under the **Amrit Bharat Station Scheme** to enhance passenger information.
- Separately, MIC will supply LED Emergency **Lighting Units** for LHB coaches to the Integral Coach Factory, Chennai, with a nine-month delivery timeline.

items.title: Brembo-SGL JV ramps up brake discs in Italy & Germany
items.summary: - The Brembo-SGL JV expanded capacity by **50%** at Stezzano (Italy) and Meitingen (Germany) to meet demand for *high-performance brake discs*.\n- The **€150 million** investment funds the expansion, part of ongoing Brembo-SGL plans.\n- The venture produces *carbon ceramic discs* for braking systems in high-end luxury and sports cars.

items.title: Mother Dairy to pass on 100% GST benefit, prices on most products to decline from Sep 22
Avaada Group commissions 11 solar plants in Maharashtra under MSKVY 2.0
India adds 23 GW renewable capacity in 5 months; ranks 3rd globally in power growth: Joshi
As aircraft orders grow, Aequs gears up to spread its wings at Belagavi
All you need to know about the new tax rates in GST 2.0 era
items.summary:
- *GST 2.0 FAQs* from the *Finance Ministry* explain rate cuts, *MRP* relabeling, price lists, and ITC guidance across sectors like *medicines*, *drones*, *bricks*, and *insurance*. 
- *Drones* attract a uniform *5%* GST; hotels with accommodation up to ₹7,500 per unit/day pay *5%* without ITC, with ITC not allowed for such units. 
- *Multimodal transport* rules set *5% with restricted ITC* if no air leg and *18% with full ITC* if any leg is by air; ITC rules for inputs vary accordingly.

items.title: Re-labelling not mandatory; GST relief to consumers
items.summary:
- *GST relief* on medicines stocked before Sept 22, 2025 applies if price compliance is ensured at the retailer level, with no mandatory re-labeling.
- Manufacturers/marketers must issue revised price lists (Form V/VI) reflecting revised GST rates and revised MRP, per NPPA guidance.
- The reform reduces GST on many drugs and devices to 5% (or nil in some cases), delivering *consumer relief* from Sept 22, 2025.

items.title: OpenAI announces upgrade for Codex with new GPT-5 version
items.summary:
- OpenAI unveiled *GPT-5-Codex*, a GPT-5‑based Codex that can extend its thinking time up to seven hours to tackle tasks in real time. 
- It *outperforms GPT-5* on SWE-bench Verified and *code refactoring* benchmarks and is trained to conduct *code reviews*, with broader availability across ChatGPT Plus/Pro/Business/Edu/Enterprise and future API access. 
- The upgrade strengthens Codex against competitors like *Claude Code*, *Anysphere Cursor*, and *GitHub Copilot*, a move praised by OpenAI CEO *Sam Altman*.

items.title: India planning legal framework to boost private participation in nuclear sector: AEC Chairman Mohanty
SpaceX court OKs Starship launches in South Texas
items.summary:
- The court ruled that the *FAA*'s evaluation of *Starbase* operations in *South Texas* was adequate, allowing continued launches. 
- The decision enables SpaceX to accelerate testing and expand facilities at *Starbase*, advancing its Starship and Mars ambitions. 
- Environmental groups maintain concerns about wildlife and ecosystems, but the ruling emphasizes a balance between protection and rapid commercial space development.

items.title: SpiceJet adds 8 more Boeing 737s ahead of festive rush
items.summary:
- SpiceJet will lease eight additional *Boeing 737* aircraft to bolster its *fleet* ahead of the *festive* and *winter* season. 
- The latest deal brings SpiceJet's total *fleet additions* to 18 aircraft, including two earlier agreements to lease 10 jets starting deliveries in October. 
- The airline has faced financial strains, settling disputes with *lessors* and *creditors* and repaying debt while reporting a quarterly loss and delays in returning grounded aircraft to service.

items.title: Pilots’ body warns DGCA fatigue plan could risk safety
items.summary:
- *ALPA India* warns that DGCA's proposed *Fatigue Risk Management System (FRMS)* could become a tool for operators to extend duty periods unless strict safeguards are in place.
- It urges delaying nationwide adoption until the final probe report into the Air India crash is completed and related safety recommendations on fatigue are incorporated.
- It calls for FRMS to be implemented as a *Civil Aviation Requirement (CAR)* after broad stakeholder consultations, with independent pilot oversight and measurable safety benchmarks.

items.title: India's exports rise 6.7% to $35.1 bn in Aug
items.summary:
- India’s *exports* rose 6.7% to **$35.1 bn** in August, while *imports* fell 10.1% to **$61.6 bn**, narrowing the trade deficit to **$26.5 bn**.
- Commerce secretary *Sunil Barthwal* attributes the gain to four pillars: *competitiveness*, market diversification, resilient supply chains, and better market access.
- The government pursues export growth via ~50 market strategies, a ₹25,000 crore package, and faster India–**EU** trade talks.

items.title: Consumers stay high on sugar-based products
items.summary:
- *Institutional sugar consumption* climbs to 60-65% in 2023-24 from 50-55% in 2018-19, even as FMCG players claim to reduce sugar.
- The largest segments are *non-alcoholic beverages* (35-40%) and *confectionery* (15-18%), driven by mid-income and rural demand for sugar-rich foods.
- Affluent households move toward low-sugar options while *mid-income* groups maintain high refined sugar use, signaling a clear income-based bifurcation.

items.title: F&B sector drives growth in retail leasing
items.author: Kailash Babar; ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The *F&B sector* is reshaping *retail real estate*, driving demand for high streets and malls.
- Data from JLL shows about *4 million sq ft* of leasing in the top seven cities and F&B's share rising to *22%* of retail activity in 2025.
- By 2028, roughly *6 million sq ft* of new F&B space is expected, with developers dedicating up to *25%* of space in destination malls.

items.title: PM Modi pushes jointness, innovation at Commanders' Meet
items.summary:
- PM Modi urged the defence ministry to swiftly implement steps for greater *jointness*, *atmanirbharta* and *innovation* to meet evolving battlefield needs.
- He spoke at the three-day **Combined Commanders Conference (CCC) 2025** in Kolkata, underscoring reforms and future plans for the coming years.
- The conference will review structural, administrative and operational matters to enhance *military preparedness* amid evolving global uncertainties.

items.title: Megha wins ₹5,700-cr private SPR project
items.summary:
- Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Ltd has won a *₹5,700-crore* mandate to build and operate India’s first **private-sector strategic petroleum reserve** at Padur, Karnataka.
- The project aims to store *2.5 million metric tonnes* of crude oil at Padur, with **five years** to build and **60 years** to operate, boosting India's SPR capacity from **39 million barrels**.
- The deal marks Megha's shift from *EPC contractor* to SPR operations, enabling revenue from leasing and trading while **ISPRL** oversees emergency preparedness.

items.title: US reinterprets arms pact to ease drone exports
items.summary:
- The United States reinterprets export controls to treat drones as fighter jets rather than missiles, easing approvals under the *MTCR*. 
- The policy unlocks larger drone sales, including more than 100 MQ-9s to Saudi Arabia and expanded deals to the UAE and Eastern Europe, amid competition from Israel, China and Turkey. 
- Major manufacturers such as General Atomics, Kratos, and Anduril can join *foreign military sales*, enabling easier international deals.

items.title: India's smartphone exports cross ₹1 lakh crore; Apple leads
items.summary: - India's smartphone exports crossed *₹1 lakh crore* in the first five months of FY26, setting a new record.\n- *Apple*'s contract manufacturers, *Tata Electronics* and *Foxconn*, accounted for nearly *75%* of outbound shipments.\n- The *US market* and the *PLI scheme* helped India become a manufacturing hub, with *78%* of domestically assembled iPhones destined for the US in H1 2025 and a *44%* share of US imports.

items.title: India’s IT eyes chip, electronics foray
items.author: Beena Parmar
items.summary:
- *Wipro’s $375 million stake in Harman’s Digital Transformation Solutions—and its tie-ups with Samsung—signal IT majors expanding into electronics and semiconductors.*
- *Infosys, Cyient, L&T, TCS with Tata Electronics, HCLTech with Foxconn and Intel Foundry deals show India building an end-to-end semiconductor ecosystem with government backing.*
- *India’s semiconductor market could rise from ~$45-50B in 2024–25 to ~$100-110B by 2030, while the global market nears $2T by 2032, fueling GenAI-driven demand.*

items.title: Recycling rare earths to ease supply gaps
items.summary:
- The McKinsey report warns that BEVs and wind demand will triple by 2035, while primary supply remains highly concentrated in *China*, risking gaps that *circular recycling* could help bridge.
- It projects about 40 kt of pre-consumer and 41 kt of post-consumer REE scrap by 2035, underscoring the potential of *circular REE magnet value chains* despite labor-intensive dismantling and smelting losses.
- Promising pathways include *robotic disassembly*, hydrogen-based processing, and bulk metallurgical methods to unlock significant secondary REE supply from devices.

items.title: NTPC looking to set up standalone nuclear projects: Chairman
items.summary:
- **NTPC** aims to set up nuclear power projects through both joint ventures and on a *standalone basis*, per *CMD Gurdeep Singh*. 
- It is collaborating with *technology providers* and **state governments** to explore individual nuclear projects. 
- NTPC's current installed capacity stands at about 82,926 MW across coal, liquid fuel, hydro and solar, signaling a diversified portfolio.

items.title: Goa gets its first hazardous waste treatment plant
items.summary:
- *Goa* has commissioned its first *hazardous waste* treatment and disposal plant at Pissurlem, Sattari, a ₹125 crore project by *Ponda Envocare Limited (PEL)* under state oversight. 
- The facility combines landfill, *incineration*, and pre-processing with capacity to handle landfillable, incinerable, and co-processing waste, with live monitoring for *safety*. 
- It will create local jobs (about 80% of workers Goan) and prevent contamination through strict *safety* protocols.

items.title: India's D2M chip at IBC; 5G delay to 2028
items.summary:
- At IBC 2025 in Amsterdam, *India* showcased an indigenously designed *D2M* (Direct to Mobile) broadcasting chip with broad device support, signaling market readiness.
- Qualcomm indicated the first wave of *5G Broadcast* silicon will ship only in 2028 and will appear on new premium devices, not as a standalone chip.
- Policy momentum and global interest (e.g., *Brazil*) could accelerate *India's indigenous semiconductor ecosystem*, bringing *D2M* to hundreds of millions of feature-phone users.

items.title: Applied Materials eyes India Semicon Mission partners
items.summary:
- *Applied Materials* is in talks with ISM partners like SiCSem and HIPSPL to supply equipment and software in India. 
- The company seeks to support SCL Mohali upgrades and Tata's Dholera fab with local offices and logistics, while training staff from regional hubs. 
- Bengaluru remains a key R&D hub; they plan more hiring and to attract suppliers such as Horiba, Rockwell, Merck and Linde to India.

items.title: Chip companies grapple with import curbs on raw materials
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Semiconductor firms face hurdles in importing critical raw materials such as *gold wire*, *solder paste*, epoxy compounds and lead frames due to licensing and duties.
- Industry proposes a 10-year zero-duty import regime under the *IGCR* framework to boost cost competitiveness and reduce import dependency.
- About 25 materials, including solder balls, gold-coated copper wires, palladium and *silver epoxy syringes*, require *DGFT* licences and are hard for small players to source.

items.title: BJD rally over fertiliser scarcity near Raj Bhavan
items.summary: - *BJD* workers protested in Odisha to highlight the 'acute scarcity' of fertilisers, staging a rally near *Raj Bhavan* and leveling allegations against the administration.\n- The protest turned tense when demonstrators tried to breach barricades; police used mild force but later allowed some leaders to enter *Raj Bhavan* to submit a memorandum.\n- Leaders warned the agitation could intensify and spread if demands aren't met, citing high fertiliser prices and alleged mismanagement by the government.

items.title: Japanese investments surge in Karnataka
items.summary:
- *Sumitomo Corporation* is investing **₹2,345 crore** in a greenfield steelmaking facility in Koppal, while *Honda* plans **₹600 crore** EV unit in Narasapura and *JFE Shoji* earmarks **₹400 crore** for NGEF revival in Hubballi.
- Currently, about *50%* of Japanese companies operating in India are based in Karnataka, which is expanding alliances with top firms like *Yaskawa*, *Air Water*, *Yamaha Robotics*, *Konoike*, *Mitsubishi Electric*, and *Yokogawa Electric* to cement its status as a manufacturing hub.
- Beyond these deals, *Shinko Nameplate* (₹100 crore) and *Cataler* (₹140 crore) are expanding, with *Hitachi*, *Renesas*, *Asahi Kasei*, *Saginomiya*, and *Inabata* boosting activity in the state.
